title: How to Make a Liver Cleanse

steps.title: Understand the benefits of this cleanse.
steps.content: Understand the benefits of this cleanse. This 3-week detox may help remove toxins from the liver. The vitamin C in grapefruit can help boost your immune system, improve your iron absorption, and protect against toxins. [1] X Research source However, there’s no reliable evidence that it can prevent or treat gallstones or any other ailments. [2] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source It may alleviate problems such as chronic acne, yeast infections, and symptoms associated with a leaky gut. To make 1 drink, you'll need extra virgin olive oil and 1 large peeled grapefruit (or orange).

steps.title: Prepare the grapefruit mixture.
steps.content: Prepare the grapefruit mixture. Place a peeled grapefruit and 1 to 2 US tbsp (15 to 30 mL) extra virgin olive oil in a glass. The whole grapefruit offers fiber for increased gut health. [3] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source Olive oil decreases heart disease and protects against cancer and other diseases. [4] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Add some honey or sugar for additional sweetness.

steps.title: Drink the cleanser every day for 3 weeks.
steps.content: Drink the cleanser every day for 3 weeks. Blend a new drink each morning and drink the entire glass to get the most benefits from this liver cleanse.

steps.title: Understand the benefits of this cleanse.
steps.content: Understand the benefits of this cleanse. This detox is used to cleanse the liver and may eliminate bloating and increase energy levels. Cranberry juice contains vitamin K, which is needed to make proteins in the liver that cause blood to clot. [5] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source It also contains vitamin C, which helps your cells protect against free radicals that may play a role in cancer and other diseases. [6] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source To perform this cleanse, you will need unsweetened cranberry juice, cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, 2-3 oranges, 2-3 lemons, and stevia (a natural sweetener).

steps.title: Prepare your body for the cleanse.
steps.content: Prepare your body for the cleanse. Before you perform this cleanse, prepare your liver by following a healthy diet in the 7 days running up to the cleanse. Eating fresh, unprocessed foods may help you avoid feeling tired and sluggish on the day of the cleanse. [7] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source Eat lots of green leafy vegetables (lettuce, cabbage, kale), cruciferous vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts), citrus fruits, sulfur-rich foods (eggs, garlic and onions) and liver-healing foods (asparagus, beets, celery). Make sure to drink plenty of water (15.5 c (3.7 L) for men and 11.5 c (2.7 L) for women). [8] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Hepatologist Dr. Raj Vuppalanchi recommends avoiding “foods rich in carbohydrates and high fructose corn syrup.” [9] X Expert Source Raj Vuppalanchi, MD Academic Hepatologist Expert Interview. 28 October 2020.

steps.title: Prepare the cleansing cranberry drink.
steps.content: Prepare the cleansing cranberry drink. On the morning of the cleanse, prepare the cranberry drink. First, dilute the unsweetened cranberry juice to a quarter of its original strength with filtered water to make 72 fl oz (2.1 L) liquid. Add this cranberry water to a saucepan and bring to a low boil over medium heat. [10] X Research source Add ground cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg to a tea ball and place in the boiling cranberry water. Allow the water to simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, then take off the heat. Once cooled, squeeze the oranges and lemons and add their juice to the cranberry water. Taste the liquid and add a couple of packets of stevia for sweetness, if desired.

steps.title: Drink the cranberry mix in the morning and throughout the day.
steps.content: Drink the cranberry mix in the morning and throughout the day. On the day of your cleanse, drink the cranberry water. For maximum benefits, make sure to drink a cold glass of cranberry juice on an empty stomach in the morning to help the antibacterial agents coat your digestive and urinary tracts. [11] X Research source Take a colon-caring supplement (such as 2 teaspoons of powdered psyllium husks or 2 tablespoons of ground flaxseed) twice throughout the day — once in the morning and once in the evening.

steps.title: Allow your body to recover from the cleanse.
steps.content: Allow your body to recover from the cleanse. For the three days following the cleanse, follow the same dietary guidelines as required for the week before the cleanse to maintain a healthy liver. To improve your gut health, incorporate some healthy bacteria into your diet from organic, raw sauerkraut or plain yogurt containing live, active cultures. [12] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Understand the benefits of this cleanse.
steps.content: Understand the benefits of this cleanse. Apple cider vinegar has long been used as a home remedy for liver cleansing and blood purification. It may also have other benefits, such as lowering blood sugar, calming acid reflux, and promoting weight loss. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Although apple cider vinegar is safe to use in most cases, it can irritate your throat in large amounts and interact with other supplements or medications like diuretics or insulin. [14] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Buy organic, unfiltered apple cider vinegar.
steps.content: Buy organic, unfiltered apple cider vinegar. Buy organic unfiltered apple cider vinegar, as this may contain a higher nutritional content. Shake the bottle before pouring to distribute the thicker, hazier-looking layer at the bottom—this is a probiotic known as "the mother" that may have health benefits. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Take the apple cider vinegar on a daily basis.
steps.content: Take the apple cider vinegar on a daily basis. Apple cider vinegar can be used to detox your liver on an ongoing basis and doesn't require any fasting. All you need to do is add 1 tsp (4.9 mL) of the vinegar to a mug of warm water and drink it before or after every meal. [16] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Alternatively, you can add 1 or 2 US tbsp (15 or 30 ml) of the apple cider vinegar to a large glass of water and drink it first thing in the morning, on an empty stomach.

steps.title: Use apple cider vinegar in other ways.
steps.content: Use apple cider vinegar in other ways. Alternative ways to add more apple cider vinegar to your diet include: Making a tea by adding 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of apple cider vinegar to hot water. [17] X Research source Add honey to sweeten. Making a salad dressing by mixing apple cider vinegar with flaxseed oil and honey.

steps.title: Eat garlic.
steps.content: Eat garlic. Taking garlic can decrease oxidative stress and fatty acids associated with fatty liver disease. [18] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source It also contains two natural compounds called allicin and selenium which support healthy liver function. However, high doses of garlic can cause liver damage. Try to limit your intake to 0.1 to 0.25 grams (less than 1 clove) per 1 kg (2.2 lb) of body weight per day. [19] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Eat green, leafy vegetables.
steps.content: Eat green, leafy vegetables. Green, leafy vegetables such as spinach, kale, cabbage, collard greens, and microgreens can provide a multitude of liver-cleansing benefits. [20] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source They contain vitamin K, which helps blood clot and wounds heal. [21] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Dr. Vuppalanchi says that “if you eat fresh vegetables, particularly green leafy vegetables, you would be replenishing the minerals and vitamins” necessary for good liver health. [22] X Expert Source Raj Vuppalanchi, MD Academic Hepatologist Expert Interview. 28 October 2020.

steps.title: Eat grapefruit.
steps.content: Eat grapefruit. Grapefruit contains a special protein called glutathione, which helps repair cells damaged by pollution or stress and protects against gall stones and other health issues. [23] X Research source Enjoying a whole grapefruit or drinking a glass of freshly-squeezed grapefruit juice may aid the liver cleansing and boost your body’s vitamin C, vitamin A, and antioxidant content. [24] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: Eat avocado.
steps.content: Eat avocado. Avocados are also high in glutathione, a compound which protects the liver from toxins. Some research has suggested that eating avocados may help reverse liver damage caused by fatty liver disease. [25] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Avocados also contain anti-oxidant, anti-inflammatory, and weight loss properties. [26] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Eat nuts like walnuts.
steps.content: Eat nuts like walnuts. Walnuts contain glutathione, an amino acid called l-arginine, and omega-3 fatty acids, all of which can help fight inflammation. [27] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Other nuts, like almonds and pistachios, are high in vitamin E, which can help people with fatty liver disease. [28] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Try munching on a handful of nuts as a snack, or sprinkling them over a salad. Nuts are also high in protein, which can be helpful if you have advanced liver disease or are struggling with muscle loss that’s related to your liver problems. [29] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Eat turmeric.
steps.content: Eat turmeric. Turmeric is something of a liver-cleansing superfood—it contains curcumin, which can protect the liver from toxins and helps to regenerate damaged liver cells. [30] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Try adding turmeric to lentil curries and stewed vegetable dishes to take advantage of its detoxifying benefits. Curcumin can also reduce bloating and stimulate the gallbladder to produce bile, which may improve digestion. [31] X Research source Turmeric extract can protect against liver injury. [32] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: Know what to avoid.
steps.content: Know what to avoid. There are certain foods and ingredients that work against the liver, overloading it with toxins and hindering its proper function. Such foods include processed, fatty foods like preserved meat (sausages, corned beef), deep fried food, and margarine and hydrogenated oils. [33] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Dr. Vuppalanchi says that “Studies have shown that high fructose corn syrup in the diet, excess calories from carbohydrates, particularly refined flour, sugars, [and] juices” result in the “fatty infiltration of the liver… ultimately leading to metabolic syndrome, cirrhosis and liver failure.” [34] X Expert Source Raj Vuppalanchi, MD Academic Hepatologist Expert Interview. 28 October 2020.

steps.title: Take supplements.
steps.content: Take supplements. There are many natural supplements which might help detoxify the liver and promote liver health. Some of the most popular include malic acid, burdoc, dandelion root and milk thistle. [35] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source These can be found at the pharmacy or health food store and must be taken according to the instructions on the packaging.

steps.title: Drink detoxifying teas.
steps.content: Drink detoxifying teas. Certain herbal teas are believed to flush toxins and fat deposits from the liver, while also increasing hydration levels. [36] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The best teas for liver cleansing include ingredients such as dandelion root, ginger, clove, burdock root, chamomile, cinnamon and horsetail. Try to drink at least two cups of herbal tea per day and sweeten with honey if necessary. The caffeine in coffee can protect you from developing fatty liver disease and is beneficial for those with hepatitis C and other liver diseases. Aim to drink 3 cups every day.
